bug.author: jesudasvf
bug.summary: Issue in building docker container for Keras classifier model on Win 10, Python 3.6.8, bentoml : 0.7.8
bug.description:
When trying to build a docker container, for a successfully served keras based classifier model locally, on Window 10 machine, returns with a failure " /bin/bash: /bento/bentoml_init.sh: /bin/bash^M: bad interpreter: No such file or directory " To Reproduce
Create a Keras model service in bentoml Test the service by serving it locally and getting the prediction output Use the service to build a docker container using the command " docker build -t keras_speech_emo_classify ."
Expected behavior The docker container should be created successfully Screenshots/Logs The terminal output of the docker build command is given below.
(spemoenv_tf2_bentoml) C:\Users\Jesudas\bentoml\repository\SpeechEmoClassificationService\0.1.20200601170502_1448B0>docker build -t keras_speech_emo_classify . Sending build context to Docker daemon 7.098MB Step 1/18 : FROM continuumio/miniconda3:4.8.2 4.8.2: Pulling from continuumio/miniconda3 68ced04f60ab: Pull complete 9c388eb6d33c: Pull complete 96cf53b3a9dd: Pull complete Digest: sha256:456e3196bf3ffb13fee7c9216db4b18b5e6f4d37090b31df3e0309926e98cfe2 Status: Downloaded newer image for continuumio/miniconda3:4.8.2 ---> b4adc22212f1 Step 2/18 : RUN set -x && apt-get update && apt-get install --no-install-recommends --no-install-suggests -y libpq-dev build-essential && rm -rf /var/l ib/apt/lists/* ---> Running in 7adb4c3262da

comments.comment: hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jesudasvf>@jesudasvf</denchmark-link> , could you try replacing the first line in the Dockerfile, from to and run the docker build again?

Sure, Chaoyu, I will try as you mentioned and run the docker build.
Thanks, Jesudas <denchmark-link:#>…</denchmark-link>
On Tue, Jun 2, 2020 at 10:34 PM Chaoyu ***@***.***> wrote: hi @jesudasvf <https://github.com/jesudasvf>, could you try replacing the first line in the Dockerfile, from #!/bin/bash to #!/usr/bin/env bash and run the docker build again?
— You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#753 (comment)>, or unsubscribe <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AJSRIFC4QDGG57HVWVTRTOTRUUWJHANCNFSM4NQSWM7A> .

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/parano>@parano</denchmark-link> , the first line the dockerfile is not #!/bin/bash. please check the dockerfile attached, along with bentoml_init.sh and docker-entrypoint.sh files. Let me know the line in which file needs to be changed. All the three files are zipped in the attached zip file. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bentoml/BentoML/files/4731473/docker-entrypoint.zip>docker-entrypoint.zip</denchmark-link>

hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jesudasvf>@jesudasvf</denchmark-link> , my bad, I mean the shell file where the error was coming from, it's the file under the saved bundle directory that needs this change.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jesudasvf>@jesudasvf</denchmark-link> does that change fix your docker build?
closing now as there's no response, feel free to reopen if you still have this issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jesudasvf>@jesudasvf</denchmark-link>
